section.name: Possible causes of screening inaccuracies
section.summary:
Translators who use the Washington State Screening Tool with ELL students should be mindful of the possibility of inaccuracies in translated responses. For example, inaccuracies may occur when a family member who is translating sees a need to shield the individual being screened. 

In addition, the use of screening questions regarding school history may be limited since school attendance can have different meanings in different cultures.

More Information

Please note, there is a validated tool available for Spanish speakers called the Empire State Screen: Learning Needs Screen for Spanish-Speaking Adults. This tool was developed through the Learning Disabilities Association of Western New York.  Additional resources for using this tool are available from the Learning Disabilities Association of New York State.
